page.title: 09TO BE A FARMER'S WIFE
page.content: A normal working day begins at 7a.m. with breakfast for the family of 4. Feet into wellies & it's off to feed the free range hens a hot mash, not an easy job, slithering in mud in pouring rain. Back to the farmhouse to tackle all the daily household chores before coffee break. Be it market day it's back out to help gather & pen the sale stock ready for loading. A lot of time & sweat lost. Lunch time is usually 12o'clock, work dictates. Must have plenty in the pots for 'drop ins'. Baking is the next job. The telephone rings. It's for the Farmer. Search & shout 'phone'. More dirt trailed in. Hens to feed, eggs to collect & clean. School is out.Boys are starving. Meal at 5.30p.m. Wash up & tidy up then attend to any mail.At last it's off to the Rural or Guild, or fireside,T.V. & knitting. A hectic yet satisfying day.
